alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Southern Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Belknap, northeastern Merrimack and south central Carroll Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Meredith to near Franklin. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laconia, Franklin, Meredith, Moultonborough, Loudon, Alton, Gilmanton, Canterbury, Wolfeboro, Belmont, Gilford, Andover, Hill, Tilton, Sanbornton, Northfield, New Hampton, Salisbury and Tuftonboro. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 54 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
